titleStmt.title: A treatise of effectual calling and election. In XVI. sermons, on 2 Pet. 1.10 Wherein a Christian may discern, whether yet he be effectually called and elected. And what course he ought to take that he may attain the assurance thereof. Preached by that faithful servant of Christ, Mr. Christopher Love, late minister of Lawrence Jury, London.
titleStmt.author: Love, Christopher, 1618-1651.

titleStmt.title: A treatise of effectual calling and election. In XVI. sermons, on 2 Pet. 1.10 Wherein a Christian may discern, whether yet he be effectually called and elected. And what course he ought to take that he may attain the assurance thereof. Preached by that faithful servant of Christ, Mr. Christopher Love, late minister of Lawrence Jury, London.
titleStmt.author: Love, Christopher, 1618-1651.
Calamy, Edward, 1600-1666.
Cross, Thomas, fl. 1632-1682,

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Rothwell, and are to be sold by John Clark, entering into Mercers Chappel, at the lower end of Cheapside.,

notesStmt.note: Editors' note "To the reader" signed: Edmund Calamy [and four others].
Portrait of the author signed: T. Cross sculpsit.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "& martyr" inserted after 'faithful servant'; "May 13".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: John Clark, entering into Mercers Chappel
